question: Who has been appointed as the new Prime Minister of Jordan?
explanation: Omar Razzaz, a Harvard-educated former senior World Bank official, has been appointed as the new Prime Minister of Jordan by King Abdullah II. He succeeded Hani Mulki, who recently resigned as a result of widespread protests against his governmentâ€™s austerity program. Prior to this post, Razzaz served as education minister in the outgoing Mulki government.
